item.title: Huge ampunt of cardboard boxes and wooden pallets tipped, 16th August
item.description:
This heap of rubbish is blocking the road at the end of Stanford Place. It was dumped on Friday morning. The cleaner is very disheartened with this constant fly tipping. He saw the vehicle it was unloaded from. I have more photos of airline bills and business addresses but cannot upload more

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanford Place, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain on Road outside 31 Greenways completely blocked with detritus and leaves - causing flooding outside house and neighbouring houses after heavy rainfall, 16th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenways, Beckenham, London

item.title: Over hanging plants, 16th August
item.description:
Outside number 12 Sherwood Park Avenue over hanging tree and bush from number 12 garden, hit me in the face and caught me in the eye, completely blocks public footpath, you have to duck right down to avoid being hit in the face !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12A, Sherwood Park Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London

item.title: Fallen large branch- Cator Park, 16th August
item.description:
Sadly we have lost another branch on the oak tree you have recently dealt with Please can you come and look at the tree - It’s in the middle of the three opposite the copies of Pines on Aldersmead Road Please can we keep the branch - we would like the mulch and keep the main log to turn it into log seating and a log pile or something etc Millie from The Friends

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldersmead Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kirkham Street is not a dump, 16th August
item.description:
Despite the continues requests to treat the residents of Kirkham Street with some dignity, this street keeps being ignored and not regularly cleaned. Sweepers will clean PCR but not Kirkham street, despite the fact that this street is used regularly by people using the shops on the slade parade. These people park on Kirkham street and litter Kirkham street, NOT Plumstead common road. Can the council or its agents please use some sense and send sweepers REGULARLY on kirkham street?! We pay council tax too!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kirkham Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stagnant water from back of KFC, 16th August
item.description:
Water is still running across the footway from the back of KFC. I reported this to Lambeth in June and they suggested contacting 'Food and health safety' but sadly did not provide a response. Hence the repost as clearly KFC are either unaware or do not care.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalton Street, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several doors, a gate and a double mattress dumped by our skip, 16th August
item.description:
A van came at night and dumped this by our skip It’s several internal doors, a outside gate and a double mattress They’ve tried to use the skip and it’s been illegally dumped

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Amherst Drive, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water collects in road making it health hazard, 16th August
item.description:
There is something wrong with the construction of the road or the drainage on the road as water does not drain away and leaves an entire area in standing water. This is obviously a health hazard as people park in this space. Please can you rectify the problem via civils works.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Clarence Avenue, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewage on pavement and driveway, 16th August
item.description:
Due to the recent heavy rains our street gutters overflowed with sewage. This has dried out over the last few days and is now hardened on the pavement and road. It needs a good high pressure wash.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Close, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
